Name: ハリネズミは時計回りに (Hedgehog go around clockwise)
Description:
ãƒãƒªãƒã‚ºãƒŸã¯æ™‚è¨ˆå›žã‚Šã« (Hedgehog go around clockwise) is a puzzle-like board game from Japan that mixes elements of the traditional game Mancala and drafting dice. The game has polyhedral dice in different colours (d6, d10, d20). Players are alchemistic hedgehogs who go around collecting dice on their spines, to deliver them to their storerooms and laboratories. Each hedgehog has their own circuit, moving dice around in a way similar to mancala games.

The dice are then combined to make more and more creatures, which earn the hedgehogs gold coins and victory points. By combining different sets of d6 dice, the hedgehog gains certain d10 dice. Then, combining those in sets earns d20 dice, which lead to the most rewarding creatures.

At the end of the game, the hedgehog with the most points is the winner.

The publisher says:
A sensational new game woven by drafting dice around a mancala, mixing them to complete formulas and build up victory points!

You are a hedgehog alchemist. Every day you deliver magical materials to the Alchemist Guild for a rich old age.
Your small hands are not enough, so you can carry the materials around by sticking them into the needles on your back. Collect snails, frogs, and small dragon materials and deliver them to the guild to earn gold coins.

After delivery, turn around again and return the materials one by one to the storage. Mixing the colors of the dice is the key to acquiring new materials (dice). To get an orange frog (decahedron), you need red and yellow snails (hexahedron) and so on! The guild will give you gold coins when you deliver the materials you have acquired. After delivery, store the rest of the material (dice) in the storage.
user summary

Name: Sendas
Description:
Sendas is a two player, abstract strategy board game.
The action takes place in a 9x9 grid board where players control 6 pieces each (differentiated by light and dark colors) starting from mirrored positions on opposite sides.
Players take turns moving and/or rotating one of their pieces in an attempt to reach the opposite side of the board and be the first to take one piece out of it. 
The pieces are square blocks with a white line on top called “Senda” (“Path” in English) that comes in three shapes: a straight line, an elbow, a T or a + shape.
The only rule is that all pieces of the same color must stay connected to each other by the senda at all times. You can not make a move if it disconnects your pieces or your opponent's from the rest of the same color.
The sendas of both players can also be connected, creating one long senda that allows for pieces of both colors to get mixed in an intricate pattern.

—description from the designer

Name: Arcane Bakery Clash: Boss Bake-Off 3
Description:
A 3-Card Solo Expansion for Arcane Bakery Clash.

SETUP
Select one of the Contessa cards and place it face up. Place the other two cards face-down on either side, these are Contessa's moves. Place a coin at the top of Contessa's energy track.

Remove the Cheesequake and Omen Biscotti cards. Shuffle the remaining recipe cards.

HOW TO PLAY
Play using the standard game rules, adding the rules listed below:

At the start of Contessa's turn, move down each time track by 1. If a time track is at 0, take the action shown, then remove the coin. After removing time tracks, roll 1 die. If a die matches a move that doesn't have a coin on its time track, place one on the highest number of the track.

VICTORY
If Contessa has 0 energy and you still have any, you win. If you are ever reduced to 0 energy, you lose.

Name: Persuasion
Description:
The Victorian courtship card game of deduction, catfishing, and conceding power.

Content Warning: This game presents marriage and independence as win/lose scenarios, and suggests relationships with unhealthy power dynamics.

While attending a party, you meet some suitors, full of potential wealth, standing, and passion. You’ve detailed your desires in your diary, and now you must discern who meets your needs by reading the trait cards they mail to you.

Your cards describe actions, but only the players you court will perform them. Each round, you share a card with a player, and they’ll choose which of your cards to leverage. When you find the one, send them your ring! They must reciprocate for you two to become engaged, so you must persuade them you’re compatible with their desires!

Name: Pixel Legends
Description:
Use elemental spells to "save" the village!

Team up with fellow wizards to vanquish the sinister monsters that lurk in the dungeon, and save the nearby village.  This is a noble, and honorable quest, and...oh, who are we kidding?

In reality, you're a greedy wizard who is all about fame and personal gain, and your fellow wizards are cut from the same cloth!

Even if the dungeon gets the best of you, fame lasts forever.  To satisfy your thirst for a legacy, you must prevail over your opponents by learning the best spells and using that knowledge to outmaneuver and kill-steal in the dungeon, so you can gain the admiration of the townsfolk, fame across the realm, and acheive....  PIXEL GLORY

Name: Refighting History: Volume 9 – The Seven Years War: More Small Actions in the Western Theatre
Description:
Looking at the Seven Years War, military historians tend to concentrate on the big battles. However, the day to day campaign activity of the combatants included reconnaissance, raids, probing actions, resupply and a host of other minor operations that frequently lead to small skirmishes.

What I want to do in this volume of Refighting History is to take some of these actions, however small, and however sketchy in terms of accounts, and turn them into wargames. They will also demonstrate that you do not need large armies to wargame the Seven Years War.
The Western Theatre accounts provide details of the day to day activity by both armies. Coupled with this, the great variety of light and irregular troops provides a whole range of different unit.

The result is this volume with small historical actions refought on the wargame table. There is also a significant amount of background on the units involved coupled with art work to illustrate the uniforms.

—description from designer

The scenarios are compatible with many rulesets

Name: Keys to Riverdale High
Description:
Keys to Riverdale High is door flipping madness. Race your favourite character from the Archie comics down the halls of Riverdale High, where behind every door awaits a surprise. Just don’t let Mr. Weatherbee catch you, or it’s straight to the detention room. Gameplay is based on our best-selling tile game Keys To The Castle.

Keys to Riverdale High is a tile-based game of strategy and luck. Players must open and close doors (the tiles) to move along a path and be the first to cross to the other side.

Special cards are played to hacksaw through barred doors, use a skeleton key to unlock padlocked doors, throw a net on a player to stop them in their tracks or use secret passageways to maneuver your way to the other side.

The game is easy to learn and quick to play. With the tiles acting as the "board", there is a new outcome to each game every time the tiles and cards are shuffled.

—description from the publisher

Name: BuzzFeed 2000's Ultimate Trivia Game
Description:
So you think you know the 2000s?! Play over 400 pop culture trivia questions crammed with phat pictures, sweet trivia, and various game challenges. Relive the hot fashions, dope trends, sick movies, TV, & music! Divide into teams and face challenges like Double or Nothing, Head-To-Head Battles, Drawing, Clue Giving, Image Cards, and more! So, turn on your perfect away message and show everyone your mad 2000s skillz- because it’s never too soon to go back to the start of the new millennium.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Office: Assistant to the Regional Manager
Description:
Behind every great regional manager is a great assistant to the regional manager…” Now you can be that assistant! Take the next 20-40 minutes (depending on the number of players) to spread your influence throughout the office. Use your skills and sneaky smarts to best your opponents. Complete challenges, play raffles, place tokens and get points by taking control of locations in the office. Pull pranks when your opponents least expect. Use Schemes Cards against players to throw them off their strategy. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins. Climbing the corporate ladder can be brutal … or hilariously fun

—description from the publisher

Name: The Lion King: Pumbaa Pass
Description:
Any Lion King fan will love this new, exciting, and fun family game featuring a very hungry Pumbaa! Pumbaa’s ready for some tasty grub—icky bugs to you and me! Players take turns feeding him the colorful critters until, well, he tosses his cookies, loses his lunch—you know, pukes. Then it’s time to scramble to find the bugs you need to win! To win be the first player to match all three bugs on three different leaf cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Grad Rush
Description:
Set in Jen Eric High School, Grad Rush is a 2 player strategy board game that pits players to get their students to graduation as fast as possible. Players will play student cards to the board that advance forward every turn. Once your student and an enemy's student land on the same space they will perform a face-off, a rock-paper-scissors battle of athletes, misfits, and preps. The loser drops out and the winner continues on. Once a student gets to the opponent's side they will be added to the graduating class. Once players have 10 GPA in their graduating class they win. Players can use single use event cards to drastically alter the board to their advantage. There are also several game modes available to play including a cube draft and a 2 v 2 format with an extra copy of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Milhouette (ミルエット)
Description:
Using three cards with silhouettes on them, in Milhouette (ãƒŸãƒ«ã‚¨ãƒƒãƒˆ) players discuss their predictions and make conclusions.

In more detail, the fortune-seeking player tells everyone what they want to know, e.g., "What does my future hold?" or "Will I find a divine pet?", then draws and reveals one card, with the fortune-telling players drawing two cards each. The fortune tellers then use their two cards and the seeker's one card to make their divinations. The seeker then nominates the player whose fortune telling touched them the most, with that fortune teller scoring a point.

Name: Mushroom Sorcerer
Description:
There hangs the twin moon
among the skies
When plenty pours her elements
Nighttime splendor it is!

Elementis, a land blessed with mystical elements and ancient magic, is guarded by The Great Sorcerer with his astonishing power throughout the years. 
In every duo luna year, the Great Sorcerers’ Tournament is held at the Enchanted Forest where the winner will be awarded the secret to magic mastery as a successor in title.  
The competition is dangerous and courage is no guarantee for survival – Attack or defence, spells will be casted and battles are inevitable ! Dazzling blast of magic between the GU towers will not cease until the last man stands and wins the seat as The Great Sorcerer !

There are 3 phases in each round: 
1. Twilight
A sip of potion stimulates sorcerers’ sense of elements, giving them different powers for the rest of the night. Choose your potion wisely!

2. Night
During Night phase, sorcerers can perform 1 of the 4 actions:
a. Grow GU to gain element(s) and level up your sorcery and power. 
      Flame elements give your flame servants which destroy everything as their masters commanded.
      Stone elements give your stone servants which protects your territory.
      Water elements create drops, an essential substance for GUs’ growth, bringing the forest prosperity and abundance.
      Thunder elements form mana, providing energy for sorcerers to cast spells.
      Moon elements, the source of ancient magic. Sorcerers gain ancient knowledge by studying moon elements. Once a sorcerer controls a sufficient 
      amount of moon GUs and moon elements, one becomes the most powerful sorcerer and wins the game.
b. Ancient and powerful spell scrolls are scattered around the forest. Pick up and cast them wisely to create a chain of combo to destroy your opponents. 
c. Waging war against other sorcerers is another way to gain influence. Let your opponent know who is the great sorcerer!
d. Summoning element to gain immediate assistance and resources.

3. Daybreak
Sun rises, sorcerers get rest in the day, recharging their magic, powers and prepare the works for the coming night.

Only the sorcerer with the most influence or moon elements win the game!

Name: Coral Sea: Defending Australia
Description:
A Campaign Study

In the Battle of the Coral Sea in May 1942, the U.S. Navy thwarted the Japanese attempt to seize Port Moresby on the south-east coast of New Guinea. From there, Japanese planes could have ranged over the Coral Sea and supported landings on the north-east coast of Australia.

That didn’t happen; the Americans would win again at Midway a month later and bring an end to Japan’s offensive capability. Coral Sea: Defending Australia looks at how the Imperial Japanese Navy might have proceeded in the Coral Sea following a victory in the battle of the same name and a draw at Midway, and how the Royal Navy might have responded to this threat.

Coral Sea: Defending Australia is a Campaign Study: a short book including a dozen scenarios (four operational scenarios, eight battle scenarios) in which the British Eastern Fleet defends Queensland from the Japanese.  You’ll need Coral Sea and Eastern Fleet to play the scenarios.

(from the publisher's website)
Families: Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Street Fighter: The Miniatures Game – Stretch Goals Box
Description:
Twelve additional fighters & battle decks that were unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign.

Also includes the car bonus stage and Capcom Cup expansion.

The Car Bonus Stage:
Would this really be a Street Fighter game without a car destroying bonus stage?
This mode uses a a special game board made of 25 rectangular spaces depicting a destroyed car with 9 double sided car tiles placed over it. The mini game can be played solo (damage as much of the car as possible) or Versus other player (Each combatant race to damage as much of the car before their oponents). 
The Car Bonus Stage add an additional movement option to help player compete with their oponents. If a character's figure enters a space occupied by an oposing figure, they may move the opposing figure a number of spaces equal to their remaining movement points. 
Players attack the car by playing attack cards as a normal action. Once a damaged tile has 3 damage, it immediately flips over to its damaged side. Once the damaged side takes 3 more damage, it is removed from the board.
Players may not damage each other.

The Capcom Cup:
The Capcom cup is a 1 versus 1 tournament style game mode.  Each player choose 3 characters. All paired players share their character cards with their oponent. They blindly remove one of the character, and return the cards to each other. Player then pick their fighter for the round out of the remaining ones.
Swiss round now begin: Use normal set up and 1 vs 1 rules. After a player is defeated, he may switch to his other fighter. The winner of the first round must stay with their current fighter until they lose. Once a player has won 2 rounds, they are the victor. 
After a certain amount of swiss round depending of the amount of players at the start of the tournament, the Top cut rounds starts. These are played similar to Swiss round. Players are paired based on Swiss results: Top ranked players vs lowest ranked player. Player that lose the Top Cut rounds are eliminated until only one player is left.

Name: Viewpoint Revisioned
Description:
Viewpoint Revisioned, the first set in the episodic Viewniverse card game series, introduces players to the Blinkers as they are transported from Myclopia to the savage world of Triclopia.  Join the Blinkers on their adventure as they attempt to avoid a grisly end to their unplanned journey.  If the Blinkers escape Triclopia, catch them in the next episode - Eye vs Eye.

The number in the top-left-hand corner of each card indicates the number of Viewpoints the card is worth and the text at the bottom is the action to be performed. In turn, players simply draw a card from the Draw Pile and play a card from their hand into their Field of View.

At the end of their turn players count the Viewpoints of the cards in their Field of View, the first player to collect 100 or more Viewpoints wins. Viewpoint Revisioned gameplay is swift to dive into and deceptively strategic. Each card provides you with Viewpoints towards your objective as well as changing the game state in a variety of ways.

Name: Stadt Land Unseriös: XMAS-Special
Description:
XMAS-Special of Take It Serious Stadt Land Unseriös with 72 different and innovative categories for great christmas time.

--

Das XMAS-Special von Take It Serious Stadt Land Unseriös mit 72 unterschiedlichen, innovativen und weihnachtlichen Kategorien für eine großartige Weihnachts- und Adventszeit.

Name: Last Stand at Mistham: A Campaign for Sellswords and Spellslingers
Description:
Goblins, orcs and ogres surround you. 

Last Stand at Mistham is a simple, goblin-and-orc smashing campaign for the Sellswords and Spellslingers solo/coop fantasy miniatures rules. 
Your heroes are tasked with stopping goblin attacks on Mistham, a peaceful village. A run of the mill job for seasoned heroes… but when the two daughters of the village chief are involved, the situation quickly becomes much more complicated.

Contents:

     Five Scenarios for 1-6 players, each running a party of adventurers built on 60 to 150 points, 
     42 pages


—description from the publisher

Name: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – Borg Sphere Starter Set
Description:
Based on the Star Trek TNG First Contact movie. Five Rings Publishing Group released the game in a Federation and Borg starter pack.

This is the Borg Sphere Starter Set
Resistance is futile. This set enables you to command the Borg Sphere and assimilate all you encounter.
25 assorted 20mm polyhedral dice; three 6-sided, five 8-sided, six 10-sided, seven 12-sided and four 20-sided dice
The dice control your ship's warp core, reserve power, shield strength, phasers, quantum torpedos, damage control, impulse power and sensors
A full-color ship Bridge/control panel from which you command ship systems and personnel
A full color ship shield and icon chart, and a 24 page Basic Training(TM) instruction book and rules.

Name: El Ñandú
Description:
El Ñandú ("The Rhea") is a competitive game, where each player represents a rhea (a kind of bird) in search of on food.
It’s a game of negotiation and speed. Each player starts with 8 cards and in one turn
Simultaneous, in real time, players must exchange their cards among themselves and collect 8 of a certain type to win, or failing that, realize when to stop, not to lose.
Multiple rounds will be played until at least one of the following rounds is fulfilled

Conditions:
Whoever manages to win 5 rounds will be called the fastest Rhea and thus win the game.
Or whoever comes last in 5 rounds will be called the slowest Rhea,
losing and ending like that, the game.

Name: 上海蒼龍-チャイニーズ人狼- (Shanghai Blue Dragon - Chinese Werewolf -)
Navio Pirata
Description:
In Navio Pirata ("Pirate Ship"), the player must go through the islands of the board to collect cards and exchange them for the cards that will form the "pirate ship". The winner will be whoever manages to collect the 6 cards first and form his pirate ship.

—user summary

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – Kainan's Reapers
Description:
When Nagash resolved to conquer Ghur, Kainan's Reapers were amongst the first forces he despatched, the tithekeepers sent to call in ancient debts and claim osseous stockpiles that might be used to bolster the Bonereapers' advance. The Mortisan Executioner Mir Kainan was charged with collecting the long-overdue tithe of the Silent People. When they arrived in Beastgrave, Kainan's Reapers found the Silent People had fled, their regular migration cycle interrupted by the mountain's anguished raging. They did not intend to return empty-handed, however. Direchasm's depths held countless ancient bones, and many rival warbands would pay the price for the Silent People's delinquency.

Bringing hitting power, magic, and disposable bone constructs to the living mountain, Kainan's Reapers are an incredibly flexible warband. Emphasise your preferred play style through the use of a range of warband-specific and universal cards, and their new tithe mechanic will help you inspire your warband. This set also features universal cards for any warband in Warhammer Underworlds, while a free downloadable warscroll lets you fight with Kainan's Reapers in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This set contains:

     6x push-fit Kainan's Reapers miniatures – no glue required to assemble
     6x fighter cards, representing each warrior in your games – Kainan, Karu, Nohem, Senha, Hakor, and Binar Khenta
     A further 62 playable cards (only available in this set) to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm, including:
     12x Kainan's Reapers objective cards
     10x Kainan's Reapers upgrade cards
     10x Kainan's Reapers ploy cards
     10x Universal objective cards, usable by any warband
     10x Universal upgrade cards, usable by any warband
     7x Universal gambit cards, usable by any warband
     3x Universal gambit spell cards, usable by any wizard

Name: Impetus Warbook 2: 43 BC to 1100 AC
Description:
Impetus Warbook 2 includes 95 army lists for Impetus second edition.

VOLUME 7: ROME AND THE EMPIRE
Early Roxolani Sarmatians (310 BC-99 AD), Nabataean Kingdom (312 BC-106 AD), Pre-Islamic Arabs (300 BC-633 AD), Kushan (135 BC-270 AD), Early Germans (100 BC-240 AD), Dacians (60 BC-318 AD), Ancient Britons (55 BC-75 AD), Later Parthian (53 BC-227 AD), Early Imperial Romans (29 BC-197 AD), Moors (25-696 AD), Alans (50-1307 AD), Jewish Revolt (66-135 AD), Caledonians (75-211 AD), Later Roxolani (100-400 AD) and other Sarmatians (310 BC-400 AD), Kingdom of Axum (100-960 AD)

VOLUME 8: ROME CRISIS AND FALL
Middle Imperial Romans (197-284 AD), Early Visigoths or Thervingi (200-419 AD) or Early Vandals (200-442 AD), Early Ostrogoths (200-493 AD), Early Sassanid Persians (224-532 AD), Alamanni (241-506 AD), Later Germans (241-495AD), Early Frankish (241-496 AD), Palmyra (260-273 AD), Later Imperial Romans (West) (285-409 AD), Later Imperial Romans (East) (285-378 AD), Later Armenian (252-627 AD), Huns (356-570 AD), Patrician Romans (409-476 AD West) (378-493 AD East), Middle Visigothic (419-478 AD), Later Visigothic (479-711 AD), Early Merovingians (481-714 AD)

VOLUME 9: BRITANNIA

VOLUME 10: ANCIENT FAR EAST
Shang Chinese (1600-1046 BC), Western Zhou (1045-771 BC), Yayoi Japanese (800 BC-250 AD), Eastern Zhou (770-481 BC), Early Warring States (480-355 BC), Later Warring States and Qin Empire (355-202 BC), Xiongnu (200 BC-216 AD), Western Han (206 BC-24 AD), Early Goguryeo Korean (37 BC-299 AD), Eastern Han (25-220 AD), Xianbei (93-430 AD), Three Kingdoms Wei (220-265 AD) & Shu Han (221-263 AD), Three Kingdoms Wu (229-280 AD), Yamato Japanese (251-793 AD), Later Goguryeo Korean (300-688 AD), Northern and Southern Dynasties (307-589 AD)

Central Asian Turkish (550-740 AD), Avars (553-826 AD), Khazars (650-965 AD), Magyars (650-997 AD), Uighurs (744-1330 AD), Khurasanian (820-1000 AD), Pechenegs (850-1122 AD)
