VOLUME 15: YEAR 1000
Later Lombards (774-1053 AD), Norse Irish (840-1100 AD), Sicilian Arabs (878-1091 AD), Principality of Hungary (997-1099 AD), Pre Feudal French (898-1050 AD), Eastern Franks and Ottonians (898-1125 AD), Normans in Normandy (911-1072 AD), Nikephorian Byzantines (963-1042 AD), Anglo Danish (1014-1075 AD), Konstantinian Byzantines (1042-1071 AD), Early Feudal Papal States (1049-1085 AD), Normans in South Italy (1042-1139 AD)

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Conflicts of the Heian period – Japan

Name: Grimdark Future: Arena – Season 1
Description:
Grimdark Future: Arena is a hex-combat miniatures game set in a war-torn sci-fi future, which is played using 28mm miniatures. 
The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging sci-fi duels for new and experienced players alike.

This is a fast-paced combat game played on a hex-board with 3-7 models per side, featuring customizable warbands and special strategies and objectives. 
The game also comes with rules for how to play without a hex-board, requiring no printing at all if you prefer.

The printable paper miniatures are formated for easy printing, cutting and folding, and they come with 1 color scheme, as well as with a black border version of all miniatures.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spukstaben Promo: Trainingsaufgaben
Description:
It's midnight at the old print shop and the little ghosts are back to steal your block letters - such SPUKSTABEN!

Can you manage together to stop the SPUKSTABEN until dawn?

Name: Energiekonferenz
Description:
Energy Conference is an environmental quiz game. In a semicircle you move your wooden figure from one field to the next. The distance is 18 fields. To move one field further, you have to answer a randomly selected question about the field topic correctly. These questions are summarized for each of four topics on a card and color-coded. In the case of difficult fields, you can call an energy conference with all players already present on the field in order to get to the bottom of the next three questions together or in competition with each other. If you are totally stuck, you can use a joker card, but it can only be used twice per player.

—user summary

Name: Card Tactics
Description:
One day, a Dragon from a faraway place made nest in our land. Chaos soon followed. Danger everywhere. A trio of heroes fought their way through unspeakable dangers to face the creature atop its mountain in a selfless effort to free the land from this menace.

Card Tactics is a pocket-sized tactical combat solo card game taking place in a gritty fantasy setting inspired by Tabletop RPGs, Fighting Fantasy books and unforgiving video games.

Win five increasingly-difficult combats using chosen heroes. Items and events will add options and unexpected challenges.

—description from the designer

Name: ペンデュラム・ドールズ (Pendulum Dolls)
Erode
Description:
Of all the habitable planets in the universe the planet named Erode is infamous for its tendency for accelerated erosion.  You are a corporation who has learned the secrets of how to manipulate and control the planet's erosion.

You will build Biomes of huge stacked land tiles in your production facility.  You will move these Biomes onto the planet.  All of these actions will permit you to build corporate bases to exploit the planet's incredible wealth.

But you are not alone, your opponents have also been successful in producing these land Biomes, and the ability to control the erosion on the planet.  You will be using this knowledge to set up Biomes in areas that you can control, and maybe using the erosion to crush your opponent's corporate bases in the process.

The object of the game is to have your corporation controlling the most productive areas of the planet.

—description from the designer

Name: Grimdark Future: Arena – Season 2
Description:
Grimdark Future: Arena is a hex-combat miniatures game set in a war-torn sci-fi future, which is played using 28mm miniatures. The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging sci-fi duels for new and experienced players alike.

This is a fast-paced combat game played on a hex-board with 3-7 models per side, featuring customizable warbands and special strategies and objectives. The game also comes with rules for how to play without a hex-board, requiring no printing at all if you prefer.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kaomi
Description:
Kaomi is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. The recommended board sizes are between 5x5 and 9x9. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

				
				
					DefinitionsIn these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a stone along with all other like-colored stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent stones of its color. The size of a group is the number of stones in it.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty square and move all stones adjacent to it one square directly away from it.

If a stone is moved to an occupied square, the stone that was originally on that square is moved one square in the same direction as the stone that landed on it, and so on.

If a stone lands outside the board, said stone is moved to the farthest square in the opposite direction, next to the edge of the board. If this square is already occupied, the stone on that square is moved one square directly toward your newly placed stone, and so on.

If two stones are moved to the same previously empty square, the one of those two stones that moved toward or past your newly placed stone is returned to its original square. If this square contains another stone that was moved on the same turn, said stone is also returned to its original square, and so on.

Your newly placed stone cannot be moved. Any stone landing on it is returned to its original square, along with all other stones that were moved in the same or the opposite direction as that stone.

The game ends when the board is full. Then, the players jointly remove pairs of opposite-colored groups of the same size from the board until there are no more such pairs to remove. The player with the biggest group left over wins. If the board is empty, whoever added the last stone to the board loses.

				
				
					Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

				
				
					VariantsSquared: A player's score is the sum of the squares of the sizes of their groups. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. Komi is used instead of the pie rule. Komi is the even number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as a compensation for playing second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games.

—description from the designer

Name: Egotzi
Description:
Egotzi is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. The recommended board sizes are between 5x5 and 9x9. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

				
				
					DefinitionsIn these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a stone along with all other like-colored stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent stones of its color. The size of a group is the number of stones in it.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty square and move every stone adjacent to it directly away from it to the first empty square it encounters. If this causes a stone to reach the edge of the board without encountering an empty square, said stone is transferred to the last empty square in the opposite direction. If there is no such empty square, the stone is returned to its original square. If two stones land on the same square, the one of those two that had reached the edge of the board without encountering an empty square is returned to its original square.

The game ends when the board is full. Then, the players jointly remove pairs of opposite-colored groups of the same size from the board until there are no more such pairs to remove. The player with the biggest group left over wins. If the board is empty, whoever added the last stone to the board loses.

				
				
					Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

				
				
					VariantsSquared: A player's score is the sum of the squares of the sizes of their groups. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. Komi is used instead of the pie rule. Komi is the even number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as a compensation for playing second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games.

Name: Fire at Sea: Bitter Enemies
Description:
A seen on Little Wars TV, Fire at Sea: Bitter Enemies allows you to refight all of the major battles between Germany’s Kreigsmarine and the Royal Navy!

These fun, action-packed rules allow you to play several engagements in an evening. 
Hunt down the mighty Scharnhorst or fight your way through the English Channel in a series of battles.  
Whether you are brand new to naval miniatures games or a veteran, these rules offer a fresh look at gaming the classic naval battles of World War Two!

You must combine skill and luck to defeat your most bitter enemy on in the North Atlantic, Arctic Ocean or off the coast of Uruguay!

YOU ARE IN COMMAND!

Turn Sequence:

     Movement Phase - alternate
     Shooting Phase - simultaneous
     Damage Control Phase - try to recover from damage
     Morale Phase - for ships that got damaged


Fire at Sea: Bitter Enemies includes the game rules and the following 16 scenarios, most of which contain multiple scenarios and can be played as mini-campaigns.

     Battle of the River Plate
     Battle of Narvik
     Operation Rhine (Sink the Bismarck!)
     The Channel Dash
     Bear Island
     Battle of the Barents Sea
     Battle of North Cape


–description from the publisher

Name: Bounty Hunters
Description:
Bounty Hunters is a lightweight card game for 2-4 players and takes about 15-45 minutes to play, the object of the game is to earn $52 to be able to buy Wild Ned, Skudmore's prize horse.

Earn money by turning in criminals for cash. Like Mr. Franklin, Chuck Glass or Tammy Tomahawks, every criminal is unique and has their own ridiculous crime, fighting style and gang that they belong to. Look out for your bounty cards, these give bigger rewards for completing their specific task, keep these secret from the other players as you all take it in turns around the table.

The game is played around the the town, five buildings set up in the middle of the players where you draw cards from, or send criminals to jail.

Each player has their criminal lineup in front of them, these are the criminals you have in custody, but don't get cocky! A unique game mechanic means that other players can take any card from your hand! (As long as they leave a bribe)  But be warned, after every completed bounty comes an Event card, something to add the wild in to the west, these cards could benefit or hinder your progress and make you change strategy!

Every card is unique and the setup is randomised ensuring that no two games are ever the same.  There are all kinds of tricks, special abilities, techniques and strategies to find so I cant wait to see what wild journeys you have.

—description from the designer

Name: ロストレガシー:文絵のために (Lost Legacy: For Fumie)
Cloak & Fang
Description:
Cloak & Fang is a competitive game for 2-4 players in which each player takes on the role of a fledgling vampire, competing for control over a small town. Control requires power, and gaining power involves manipulating the town's residents in order to feed upon their blood. Before the night is done, one vampire will stand above the rest, claiming this corner of the world for themselves!


     Be a puppet master, charming and commanding the populace
     Compete to gain the most influence and power
     Choose your strategy to outsmart and outplay your opponents


The goal of Cloak & Fang is to feed upon residents in order to gain the most blood points before the night ends. In order to do this, it is in each player's best interest to manipulate the residents of the town to increase the number of blood points they have. This is done differently per resident, based on their individual preferences. Each player will be attempting to change the state of the town to gain an advantage over the other players.

—description from the designer

Name: Sheriff of Nottingham: 2nd Edition – Festival of Nottingham
Description:
Originally available as part of Promo Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter Campaign. A deck of cards added to the game that modify certain rules from round to round.

—user summary

Name: Lemonade Tycoon
Description:
Lemonade Bosschief is about providing a fun and tailored challenge to kids and adults. By providing dynamic challenges (handicaped play) that can change from game to game, Bosschief makes it possible to see your kid grow with the game all the while providing real and fun challenge to kids and adults.

The advanced rules also provide a nice challenge for adult-adult pairings.

Focused on simple rules, variety and tons of player interactions, Bosschief introduces players to novel auctions that include push-your-luck and bluffing mechanics and an innovative grid navigating auction that's fresh and exciting. The game also presents a simple 'program' movement deduction mechanic and a guess-outguess mechanic aiming to deny your opponent's goals from being achieved.

The advanced rules also provide a nice gateway experience of action planning, denial and mayhem.

All of this with little set-up time, quick and clear rules and short play time. (45-60 minutes) With amazing artwork engaging gameplay and adapted challenge Tycoon is here to quench your thirst for a challenge and create a thirst for board games in your kids.

—description from the designer

Name: Earth Sentinel
Description:
The Earth Sentinel board game celebrates the important connections that exists in nature and between all of earth’s ecosystems, occupants, and man.

The Earth Sentinel board game is played on a 10 by 10 grid representing the earth and 50 chips for each player. Your chips represent your resources.

There are three game plays possible on your Earth Sentinel board; the linear green belts, the conglomerations belts, and the wood wide web. 

     Linear green belts - The object is for each player to plant as many trees as possible by having the highest number of consecutive treeples: 3 consecutive chips (1 point); 6 consecutive chips (3 points); and 9 consecutive chips (5 points).
     Conglomeration belts - The object is to minimize the number of unutilized chips left on the board at the end of the round by making sure your chips form triples before the round ends. Value of conglomerated chips on the board are counted incrementally. 
     Wood wide web - The object is for each player to form the highest number of consecutive chips per row. Points are calculated by calculating the difference in the highest number of consecutive chips for each player.


—description from the designer

Name: Dive!
Description:
Dive! is a card game for 1 to 2 players. Your goal is to deploy a team of divers, earn gold to improve their equipment, and ultimately recover more priceless treasure than your opponent.

You start with a simple 10 card deck and over the course of the game you can:


     Purchase Equipment cards to add to your deck and improve the effectiveness of your dive crew.
     Freedive cards for a risky boost to diving capability at the cost of permanently losing them.
     Acquire Treasure to gain immediate bonuses and ultimately decide the winner in this all out race to riches.


—description from the designer

Name: Iwari: Floating Lands + The Glaciers
Description: Iwari: Floating Lands / The Glaciers features a double-sided map for Iwari.

Name: Catapult Feud: The Royal Feast Expansion
Description:
Catapult Feud: The Royal Feast Expansion is a mini-expansion that adds a Royal special ability & a new type of ammo.

At the beginning of the game, each player receives one Royal Base. Place the base on any one of your troops. From now on, this troop is part of the Royal family and has the following special ability: During your Tactics Phase, you may move your Royal to a new valid location (per the Troop Placement rules) on your player board. This is a free action, no action card required.

The smelly fish ammo is bouncy and extremely tricky, so you need to be precise with your aim.

Note: This expansion was originally marketed and released as Catapult Kingdoms: The Royal Feast Expansion.

Includes:
- 4 x Royal Bases
- 4 x Smelly Fish Ammo
- 4 x Action Cards
- 4 x Rule Cards (2 x English & 2 x alternate language)

Name: Catapult Feud: Dice Ammo Expansion
Description:
Catapult Feud: Dice Ammo Expansion is a mini-expansion containing custom semi-soft D6 dice, where you get a 2nd shot if it lands with the Doubleshot face up. But beware if it lands with the Backfire face up, then your opponent gets to send it back at you!

Note: This expansion was originally marketed and released as Catapult Kingdoms: Dice Ammo Expansion.

Includes: 
- 4 x Dice Ammo
- 4 x Action Cards
- 2 x Rule Cards

Name: Historia Bez Cenzury. Misja: Zwycięstwo
Description:
Misja: ZwyciÄ™stwo is a strategic board game that will take you to the fronts of World War II. You will take on the role of war heroes and your task will be to carry out secret missions, the success of which will contribute to defeating the Third Reich. Your tasks will include transporting weapons, smuggling radio stations and delivering orders. This will be prevented by spies from foreign intelligence services and various adversities, which you will face as you drive such legends as the Elk or the PzKpfw VI Tiger! Earned medals will testify to your victories.

Victory Points are earned by defeating enemies or completing missions. The game ends when one of the players scores a certain number of victory points.

Name: Napad na Doomrock: Karty promo Wspieram.to
Description: 32 Promo Cards for backers of Wspieram.to project for Napad na Doomrock.

Name: Come And Play The Game
Description:
The players have to lead their basketball teams (4 game pieces) from their preliminary round locations in Germany to the final city of Cologne. To do this, they roll the dice and drag the pieces across a map. Whoever beats another figure (or their own) sends them to a basketball game, which is decided by a simple dice roll.

The winner gets to move on, the loser has to wait for the next opponent. On gray squares an event card is drawn, which also contains information about German cities.

The first player to arrive in Cologne with 2 figures wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Ein Indio darf den Tag nicht verschlafen
Description:
Each player has 2 game pieces (José and a donkey), both of which he must bring to the target field. After rolling the dice, you can move your donkey or your José. On event fields (with "typical" actions of an Indio boy) you can earn or lose money, have to sit out, move forward or back. 
The target field (the sea) can only be reached by both game pieces by rolling a 3.

—user summary

Name: Phalanx
Description:
PHALANX simulates a battle between two armies from the Iron Age.

The players take the role of generals facing each other on the field of battle, trying to destroy the enemy’s troops and pushing them out of the battlefield.

The player play cards that can act as reinforcements (sending more troops into the fray) or as orders (to direct the ones already on the battlefield).

Destroying your enemy’s troops will give you victory at the end of the day, but beware! A single enemy troop that manages to cross the battlefield and reach your command tent will force you to retreat, leaving your opponent master of the battlefield!

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Wars in the Ancient Near East

Name: Hartz Dir Einen
Description:
Players move their game piece by rolling the dice along a path from start to finish. On the way there are fields on which event cards must be drawn. These cause suspension, additional movement forward or backward. The satirically conceived texts reflect the "reality" of the unemployed. Guess who wins the game....

—user summary

Name: Talinghaga
Description:
Talinghaga is a Filipino word game inspired by Baybayin, an ancient Filipino writing system. Players combine cards with letters and syllables together to create words.  The goal of the games is score the most points by creating, stealing, and collecting words.

—description from publisher

Name: Hipp Hopp Hippo
Description:
The monkeys try to cross the river on the backs of the hippos, but sometimes a hippo dives and the monkey falls in the water.

On your turn you roll one die to move a monkey and another die to slide one of the hippos.

Name: Super Chess
Description:
Super Chess is the ultimate card game for chess enthusiasts.

It is a card-based expansion of traditional chess that puts a twist on the way traditional chess is played by introducing 36 unique cards. When activated, these cards spice up the game in a variety of unpredictable ways.

A single card might turn the tide of the game in your favour, while a card used by your opponent could take the game in a completely different direction.

—description from the designer

Name: Think Global
Description:
The players each write down 6 terms for pictures with environmental scenes. The more matches with the terms of the other players are achieved, the more points are distributed. The winner is the player with the highest point total at the end of the game.

—user summary

Name: Dead Man Blues
Description:
In this game you play the role of a musician and aspiring bandleader: starting in New Orleans in the early days, then playing the clubs in Al Capone’s Chicago, and trying to hold a big band together in New York or the West Coast in the Swing era. Your aim is to be remembered, after you’ve gone, as the greatest jazz musician of all time.

The game-play is mainly conducted through 3 types of Contract cards: Work - to earn money and reputation; Musicians - to grow your band; and Habits, which reduce your life expectancy. You can also compete with other players in Battle-of-the-Bands contests.

When the game ends, everyone dies! The player with the highest posthumous reputation wins the game.
 —description from publisher

Name: Not That Funny
Description:
Not That Funny is a tabletop game designed to uncover the damaging truths behind everyday jokes and microaggressions directed at marginalized groups and individuals. A minimum of three players are needed to play this game.

Each player should select seven Response Cards to start, and should always have that amount before the start of each round. Each player selects one Time-Out Card at the start of the game, and keeps it handy in case the game gets a little too fiery.

The shortest person will start the game as the "selector."  After each round, the person to the selector's right will take on that duty—and so on, until the game ends. The selector chooses one Situation Card from the top of the deck at the start of the round, and reads it out loud. Then, each player picks the Response Card they think fits best, and discreetly hands it over to the selector. The selector chooses "the best" Response Card, and that player is awarded one point.

If the chosen card is an NTF (Not That Funny) Response Card, another point is up for grabs.  All players EXCEPT the player that laid the NTF card can attempt to explain to the selector why the phrase is harmful or problematic. The selector decides which of the explanations is the most accurate, and awards that player a bonus point. If the selector determines that none of the players were able to answer correctly, the player that laid the NTF Response Card will be awarded the extra point.

The best way to keep score is to return the winning Response Card and NTF Response Card to the player that earned the point. We suggest 10 points to win the game. However, you can choose a higher or lower point goal depending on how long you want to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: School of Sorcery: Pet Pack
Description:
Wizards, like many, rely on furry friends to help us make it through our daily lives. As a wizard at the School of Sorcery, summon the powers of Orinitin, Sloankai, and Cranaj as you attempt to gain friends and influence at the school. Along with these pets come five new cards with unique powers.

The School of Sorcery Pet Pack includes one instruction card, three pet cards, and five new sorcery cards. The pet cards introduce a new mechanic into the game, while the five new sorcery cards--Slingshot, Icarus Stone, Flaming Sword, Curse, and Cloak--introduce new powers to the normal game.

To use the pet cards, place them face-up in the supply. If you play the "cast no crystals" card, you send a crystal to one of the pets.  If both players have a crystal on the pet card, the crystals are removed. If only one player has a crystal on a pet card, that player befriends the pet and may use the pet's power once per round. Orinitin allows you to take a crystal any time your opponent wins a card. With Sloankai, your score is increased by one for each crystal. Cranaj allows you to adjust a die up or down one pip.

To use the new sorcery cards, shuffle them into the deck and play normally. The three immediate use cards are Slingshot, Icarus Stone, and Flaming Sword. With Slingshot, you remove all crystals from one location (if you have fewer VPs). Icarus Stone allows you to remove one crystal from any location. After getting Flaming Sword, you flip the top card in the deck and use its power (but only if it is a one-time-use card). The two one-time-use cards include Curse and Cloak. Curse allows you to turn an opponent die to any result and Cloak allows you to remove an opponent crystal from the portal.

-description from designer

Name: Robinson Crusoe: Przygoda na Przeklętej Wyspie – Szklane Pomysły
Description:
It's hard for you to believe, but you find that the island contains the materials you need to create glass.... You already have some ideas on how to use them.

During the game setup, lay out the Glass Invention card along with the 9 basic Invention cards on the appropriate spaces on the board.

Then shuffle the remaining Glass Inventions into the Invention deck (with the other Invention cards), draw 5 cards from it, and lay them out on the appropriate board spaces.


CiÄ™Å¼ko ci w to uwierzyÄ‡, ale okazaÅ‚o siÄ™, Å¼e wyspa zawiera materiaÅ‚y potrzebne do stworzenia szkÅ‚a... Masz juÅ¼ kilka pomysÅ‚ów jak je wykorzystaÄ‡.

Podczas przygotowania do gry wyÅ‚óÅ¼cie kartÄ™ PomysÅ‚u SzkÅ‚o wraz z 9 podstawowymi kartami PomysÅ‚ów na odpowiednich miejscach planszy.

NastÄ™pnie wtasujcie pozostaÅ‚e Szklane PomysÅ‚y do talii PomysÅ‚ów (z pozostaÅ‚ymi kartami PomysÅ‚ów), dobierzcie z niej 5 kart i wyÅ‚óÅ¼cie je na odpowiednich miejscach planszy.
Families: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: De Bello Punico
Description:
Grand tactical system simulating four battles of the Second Punic War: Trebbia 218 BC, Beneventum 214 BC, River Po 203 BC, Zama 202 BC.

1 hex = 100 meters. 500/1000 horsemen for cavalry units, 1000/2000 soldiers for infantry units, 10/20 for elephant units, 30 minutes/turn.

Parabellum magazine IX, Spring-Summer 2021
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: D20 Baseball
Description:
It’s the bottom of the ninth, score tied, one out, and a runner on third. Your opponent is playing his infield in, looking for a squeeze play. Your batter’s a weak hitter. Will you try the squeeze anyway – or let him swing away? Will you hold your runner at third except for a hit or error? The game is on the line…. What will you do?

Major league baseball is the most popular summer sport in the USA, with a fan base of many millions. D20 Baseball is a card (and dice) driven simulation of the game, playable in about an hour. It’s based on current statistics, and will delight fans with realistic play and accurate results. No teams, so it's just you against your opponent on equal terms.

During the game, players select a card from their hands for each batter’s plate appearance, sometimes face up, sometimes face down. When revealed, only one of the cards will be used to determine the outcome: hit, walk, out, etc. A D20 (20-sided die) is often used to select one of multiple results on a card. The two played cards can also determine which player must play his or her card face up for the next plate appearance.

D20 Baseball  follows all rules and tactics of major league baseball, and includes sacrifices, squeeze plays, stolen bases, stretching for an extra base, playing the infield in, and so forth. Unlike other boardgames where the dice-rolling becomes tedious, in D20 Baseball you’ll feel tension from the card play – and that you’ve actually been in a real game after nine innings. Highly portable and easy to play, D20 Baseball is sure to please baseball aficionados of all ages.

—description from the designer'

Name: Dungeons & Dragons: Ghosts of Saltmarsh Board Game
Description:
Ghosts of Saltmarsh is an expansion for any standalone title in the Dungeons & Dragons Adventure System board game series, and it features new adventures, map tiles, monsters, traps, and spells. To use this expansion, select your favorite heroes from one of the existing games, then dive into this new campaign!

The King of Keoland, after unsuccessful expansion to the north, has turned his eyes southward, to Saltmarsh, with the intention of turning this village into an important port to increase the stature of his kingdom — but not everyone in the village is happy about the new developments, and old enemies fight for control, unaware of a new enemy about to rear its ugly head.

You come through the town gates and cross Sharkfin Bridge...to the screams of townsfolk and the unmistakable sounds of fighting. You do not know the situation but you are sure you are needed.

Return to the classic gameplay of the D&D Adventure System, with some exciting new changes! You'll still take on the role of a D&D hero, with thematic skills and abilities, either on your own or as a group of up to five adventurers. You'll face multiple scenarios in an overarching campaign, evolving and leveling up your character on the way. You'll explore treacherous dungeons, avoid deadly traps, and defeat terrifying monsters. You can also play your favorite scenarios on their own as a standalone experience!

Ghosts of Saltmarsh includes eight new highly-detailed Sahuagin miniatures, including two powerful new villains to encounter in your adventures! You'll add these to the miniatures from your Adventure System Games to populate the board, using included tokens to represent any monsters you may not already have. (If you do own the related games, feel free to replace the token with the appropriate miniature!)

In addition to the "exploring" adventures familiar to fans of Adventure System games, where tiles come out one by one, there are adventures that take place in the town of Saltmarsh itself, a set map made up of six double-sized tiles, where you'll fight to keep villagers safe from monsters after their own ends. It's an exciting and different game mode, where without exploration, the new Adventure deck provides the challenges and surprises that stand between the Heroes and success.

Integrates with:

    Dungeon Command: Blood of Gruumsh
    Dungeon Command: Curse of Undeath
    Dungeon Command: Sting of Lolth
    Dungeon Command: Tyranny of Goblins
    Dungeon Command: Heart of Cormyr


Can also integrate with:

    Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
    Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game
    Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
    Dungeons & Dragons: Temple of Elemental Evil Board Game
    Dungeons & Dragons: Tomb of Annihilation Board Game
    Dungeons & Dragons: Waterdeep â€“ Dungeon of the Mad Mage Board Game
    Dungeons & Dragons: Ghosts of Saltmarsh Board Game
Families: Series: Dungeons & Dragons Adventure System Board Games

Name: Incubation: Promo Card Set
Description:
Promo card set adding the following cards:

2 mystery eggs cards
2 hybrid eggs cards
4 objective cards

Name: Mega Empires
Description:
Mega Empires is a strategy board game for 3-18 players that covers the development of civilizations through history, from the Stone Age to the Late Iron Age. It consists of standalone games Mega Empires: The West (2019) and Mega Empires: The East (2021), which can be combined into a single game.

In this colossal game, players lead their historic civilization as they gain victory points by expanding their population, building cities, trading and developing their knowledge and culture. Notwithstanding its large scope, the game's core mechanics are straightforward and easy to learn. A key element in the game is player interaction as they position themselves on the map board and search for valuable commodities during interactive trading sessions.

Scope
Mega Empires covers two standalone games Mega Empires: The West and Mega Empires: The East. These games can be played standalone with as many as 9 players or combined with a maximum of 18 players, and take up to 12 hours to complete.

Where The West concentrates on the Mediterranean Sea, which stimulates movement by ship, The East covers Northeast Africa, the Arabian Peninsula and Southwest Asia, and has a stronger focus on movement by land. Both games were designed as equally balanced counterparts, albeit with unique characteristics.

The game was designed to be the biggest board game in the world that can be played in a single day in one room. When combined, the map board measures over 2 meters (80 inch) in width. Despite its ambitions about size and duration, Mega Empires can be scaled down to as few as 3 players (The East) or 5 players (The West), and both games also include a scenario for playing a shorter game through an accelerated start.

Gameplay
Each player starts their civilization in the Stone Age with a single population token on the board. As the game progresses, the population will expand, spread over the board, sometimes engage in conflict, and build cities. Cities bring resources and wealth, expressed in trade cards. The more cities players manage to build on the board, the more trade cards they receive. Trade cards are mainly valuable commodities, but sometimes turn out to be disastrous calamities.

Trade
Trading is the heart of the game, a social experience where all players interact with each other to optimize the value of their sets of commodities. In addition to the desired commodities, calamities are secretly traded as well, adding an additional layer to the trading dynamics. Once the trading phase has ended, players that end up with a calamity in their hand will suffer its effects.

Develop Civilization Advances
When the smoke of trading and resolving calamities has settled, players can decide how to spend the wealth gathered through trading. The game includes 51 different advances that can be developed, each of which provides benefits in the game to its holder. For example, Metal Working provides an advantage when fighting conflicts, Architecture facilitates city construction and Enlightenment reduces the impact of (civil) calamities.

The 51 Civilization advances are divided into the categories Arts, Crafts, Science, Civics and Religion, each of which has specific powers. Each advance acquired by a player provides discounts to other advances that can be purchased later in the game, thereby creating a path of strategic decisions. The ultimate advance in the game, Wonder of the World, is only in reach for players who manage both their trading and purchasing strategy very well.

Winning the Game
The players who have best developed their position on the board whilst avoiding making enemies, and defended their civilization against natural or civic calamities and stand the test of time, will eventually gather the most victory points and compete for winning the game. After up to 12 hours of playing, that is.

Expansions
Mega Empires: The Special Buildings (2024) is an expansion set that provides additional flavor to the game through 18 miniatures of ancient buildings historically associated with each of the civilizations in the game. These buildings can be built on the map board and provide additional benefits in play and victory points to their controller.

Accessories
The Mega Empires: The West â€“ Deluxe Game Mat (2024) and Mega Empires: The East â€“ Deluxe Game Mat (2024) are neoprene game mats at 125% scale of the original cardboard maps that offer an enlarged playing area and high-quality design for easier and more immersive gameplay.

The Mega Empires: Identifier Cards Bonus Pack (2024) is a set with 18 large player identifier cards, one for each of the Civilizations included in Mega Empires. These can be used for distributing the civilizations among the players during setup, to identify which stack of Civilization Advances belongs to which player, or to divide acquired cards from not yet acquired ones during the game.

Wrap-up
Mega Empires is a long strategic board game about development, trade, culture, politics and showing resilience when dealing with calamities. The game is a perfect fit for larger groups of strategic board game enthusiasts, which, due to its scalability, can also be played in smaller groups. It is not just a game, it is an experience!

—description from the designers

Name: Tussie Mussie: Orange Flowers
Description:
This expansion is part of the Tussie Mussie: Expansion Collection.


Muted colors are all well and good, but if you want to stand out you’ll need to add a little orange to your arrangement. Everyone knows that a well-placed Butterfly Weed can set you apart from the crowd. Of course, sometimes the most important part of being a trendsetter is knowing when to buck the trend. Should orange blooms become popular, you’ll need to know when to quit.

If you're comfortable with the harmonious blend of pinks and purples in the base game of Tussie Mussie, the Orange Flowers expansion is the perfect way to add a pop of color to an old favorite. Orange flowers push the player interaction with their diverse scoring: depending on which you find first, you may want to gather them all for yourself or spread them around the table. There’s also the Nasturtium, a potentially powerful (though situational) card that lets the player reorder their arrangement before scoring. Don’t let another player find out why its meaning is “victory shall be ours”!

Name: Tussie Mussie: Greenery
Description:
This expansion is part of the Tussie Mussie: Expansion Collection.


A good flower arrangement is as much about the framing as it is the flowers. Long-stemmed roses are always in vogue, and the gentle addition of a leafy fern can enhance the beauty of the blooms. Be sparing with your greenery, however: this is still a flower arrangement, after all.

The Greenery expansion introduces 5 cards that work in an all-new way. Greenery cards are great for adding a few extra points to your arrangement...as long as you don’t go overboard. One will do just fine; any more than that and you’ll lose points. Every face-down offer could be the Greenery that tips the balance, adding a delightful layer to the already rich decision-making of Tussie Mussie.

Name: Tussie Mussie: Ribbons
Description:
This expansion is part of the Tussie Mussie: Expansion Collection.


What good is the gift of flowers without a bow to tie them all together? If you really want to catch the eye of your beloved, don’t neglect the ribbon. A proper ribbon accentuates the arrangement rather than merely being an add-on. The extra effort is sure to pay off handsomely.

If you thought Greenery added something new, get ready for Ribbons! This expansion adds 8 Ribbon cards featuring extra goals that players can score in addition to their arrangement. These goals are visible throughout the game and each game will have 1, 2, or 3 of these cards based on player count. Ribbons don’t add to or replace cards from the deck, so they can easily be played alongside the other expansions for maximum enjoyment.

Name: Trivillennial: A Party Game
Description:
From Friends to The Office, Facebook to Snapchat, Keyboard Cat to Pizza Rat – test how well you know the icons, moments and controversies that have defined our generation.

Trivia categories include: 15 Seconds of Fame, Trends, Random, Controversy, Sports, Technology, Music, Food, Entertainment & Politics.

A multiple choice question is read and each player flips over a card for their answer (A, B, C, D). First person to get 10 questions correct wins the game.

Name: Achtung, Kurve!
Description:
A dice roll decides the starting point and the used vehicle for each player. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the town hall and return to his starting space while minding the traffic rules wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Expediente Iberia
Description:
A competitive game for 1 to 5 players in which cases, allies, resources, and events will be collected to face unexplained mysteries such as the Faces of Belmez, The Ummo Case, The Manises File, and all kinds of encounters with the impossible.

Every player takes the role of a detective of different kinds of X-files mysteries. Each round the players try to 'investigate' some cases ranked by difficulty using their personal skills and cards as resources. At the end of the game the researchers add up their solved cases (each one has a different score) and the player with the most point is the winner.

Juego de cartas ambientado y tematizado con los expedientes más emblemáticos del misterio en España. Es un juego competitivo compuesto por una serie de cartas y fichas en las que se recogerán casos, aliados, recursos y eventos donde de 1 a 5 jugadores podrán enfrentarse a misterios como las Caras de Belmez, El Caso Ummo, Expediente Manises, y todo tipo de encuentros con lo imposible.

—description from publisher

Name: Mit der "Ukraina" durch die UDSSR
Description:
The players start and end their flight in Aschchabad. Movement is determined by a die. If a player reaches a city, he misses a turn. The last player to return to Aschchabad wins the game.

This game was released for the 40th anniversary of the October Revolution 1917.

—user summary

Name: So Sus
Description:
So Sus is a social deduction game, with the Impostor mechanism. Players begin with hidden roles, either Impostor or Evil Empire, the Evil Empire must complete tasks and uncover the Impostor to win, Impostor players must eliminate all Evil Empire players.

Older players (like me) will recognise the mechanism from the classic Mafia and younger gamers will be understand if they have played Among Us (aka Space Mafia).  The unique thing about this game is the way in which it merges real life RPG actions with the board game. essentially the players  are immersed in the game and how well you stick to your role will determine how well you perform.

The game comes with a board, a buzzer (for calling emergency meetings), 5 categories of tasks, dice and even a meta game. The Meta Game involves multiple rounds point scoring and in real time Super Powers. such as 'Time Stop' or the 'Impostors Apprentice'. And you can add on 'vision-restricting' goggles to make being the Impostor even more fun.

The game has plenty of depth, especially when it comes to the meetings, (the part where you can talk) all sorts of bluffing negotiation and strategy comes in to play here. The intellectual level will always depend on who you play with.

Who is going to Sus the Impostor?

—description from the publisher

Name: Shiver Game: Electronic
Description:
Similar to Jenga. Remove pieces from tower and stack them on top of tower. Player who causes the tower to collapse loses.

This time the pieces are plastic and they are stacked on top of movable tray. Tray is battery-operated and shivers a random time period. This causes the stacking to be even more hazardous and can cause tower to collapse.

—user summary

Name: Riftforce: Beyond
Description:
Go beyond the Rift and discover a new plane of possibilities in Riftforce Beyond! Experience Riftforce now alone with a challenging solo mode or team up with your friends to fight together and control the Rift in epic three- or four-player games.

You will need the powers of the eight new guilds to succeed in this new hostile environment. Can you unleash the Beast, crush your opponents with the Sand, or mend wounds with the power of Love?

Name: Wer wird Kanzler?
Description:
The players move their figure (candidate) around the game board to collect money, get publicity, build their election team and advertise their program by collecting markers for each aspect. Movement is determined by a die. If a player lands on a space marked with a "?" he has to draw an event card that may benefit or hinder him.

If a player has collected markers of 50 points for each aspect, he gets to place a delegate on a free dot in the center of the game board. If a delegate is surrounded by three delegates of another color, he is replaced by a delegate of this color.

The first player to get 10 delegates on the game board wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Judgement: A 9 Card Deckbuilding Game
Description:
Children who act out of line are expected to prove whether they're worth keeping alive by killing a wild beast with nothing but their fists and their wits.

You palm the rock you smuggled in. Will you be able to survive this unjust "trial"?

Judgement is a 9 card solitaire deckbuilding game. Unlike in most deckbuilding games, when a card is "destroyed" it's not gone forever. Instead, it's rotated 180 degrees and can be purchased later. To win the game, you have to deal enough damage to kill the beast before it can kill you.

—description from the designer

Name: Tombstone Tinderbox: A Wild West Tabletop Starter Box
Description:
Tombstone Tinderbox is a complete starter box for historical miniature tabletop gaming in the Wild West. This box includes everything you need to play our 4-part Tombstone campaign covering the 1881 shootout at the OK Corral and the Earp vendetta ride that followed.

The starter box includes 15mm miniatures from Blue Moon, a felt game mat, historical cardstock buildings, trees from Woodland Scenics, a scenario booklet, custom character cards, dice, game tokens and more!

—description from the publisher

Name: Last Aurora: Waypoint Promo Tokens
Description:
This promo was published in the Italian magazine ioGioco 7/10/2020:

"As a gift to our readers, Pendragon has decided to offer a series of special waypoints to make their Last Aurora experience even more varied. You can find them at the end of the review, ready to cut out and use in your games. The new waypoints are compatible with every map (even that of the Project Athena expansion) and hide many dangers: you will risk suffering a lot of damage and running into many radioactive areas, but you may also have the opportunity to find a refuge that shelters you from enemy fire."

It adds an alternative, print-and-play set of waypoint tokens compatible with the base game and Project Athena maps. These waypoints are more dangerous than regular ones.
The list of the tokens includes:
2x regular radiation
1x radiation + bullets
1x radiation + gas
1x radiation + object
1x radiation + hit
1x hit + food
1x double hit
1x hit + object
1x hideout

The only special waypoint is the hideout: enemies and players outside cannot attack those inside. Players in the hideout can attack each other (if using the pvp module).

Name: Wonder Woman: Road Trip
Description:
In the dead of night, an attack was carried out on the soil of your homeland. The full extent of the damage is not yet known, but the Amazonian archives have been ransacked and many sacred items are missing. Whispers of an ancient prophecy begin to swirl & one that warns of an unrelenting evil. It is believed the artifacts were stolen and are to be used to release this terrible evil on the world of Man. Sworn to protect the earth, you head out to reclaim these ancient relics and put an end to this threat.

Travel through the game board collecting information on the missing artifacts. Carry out board actions, collect HIT TOKENS, and acquire TOLL PASSES while you take out enemies in BRUTE BATTLES. Gain access to ENEMY ALTARS in your search to reclaim the Amazonian artifacts. Return the artifacts to your TEMPLE to stop the prophecy and save the Earth. The first person to complete their SCORE CARD by acquiring 4 unique ARTIFACT TOKENS and return them to their TEMPLE is the winner.

Name: Ruthless: The fastest rules in the West
Description:
Ruthless: a complete set of western gunfight rules.

Sequence of play:


     At the beginning of a turn, each player is dealt 5 cards. 
     Choose 1 card face down. The cards are revealed simultaneously. Highest card goes first, allowing that player to take actions with all of their models. 
     Other players activate in sequence, ending with the lowest card. 
     The  turn  ends  when  all  models  on  the  table have  taken two actions.
     Players end the turn by each replenishing their hand back up to five cards. 


In  addition  to  determining  initiative,  cards  can  also  be played  throughout  the  turn  to  resolve  Snap  Shots,  Get Your Courage Up, and brawling in Fisticuffs. Some cards have special bonuses when played.

At the end of each turn, both sides roll 1d10. If the roll is less  than  or equal to the  number  of  your  characters currently    dead, Lily Livered, or Unconscious, the remaining men skedaddle and the game ends!

— description from publisher

Name: Stadt Land Unseriös: SOMMER-Spezial
Description:
SUMMER-Special of Take It Serious Stadt Land Unseriös with 72 different and innovative categories for great summer time.

--

Das SOMMER-Special von Take It Serious Stadt Land Unseriös mit 72 unterschiedlichen, innovativen und sommerlichen Kategorien für eine großartige Urlaubs- und Reisezeit.

Name: Dual Gauge: Honshu & Wisconsin Maps
Description:
This is the first expansion for Amabel Holland's Dual Gauge.

Honshu is a small, cutthroat map for three to four players. Money is tight and the terrain unforgiving. Along the way, you and your opponents will help industrialize Japan's largest island, upgrading low-paying dits into profitable cities. (In fact, failing to do so will result in end-game penalties!) Of course, cities can be tokened, allowing you to create chokepoints on the fly. A nasty, nasty map.

The second map shifts the scene to exotic and fantastical Wisconsin. This is a sprawling "big money" map for three to five players. The major gimmick here is that there are nine 5Ts, and these trains are "diesels" – running as far as you like along a stretch of compatible track. Plan carefully in the early game, and you can end up with a triple-digit run in the last couple Operating Rounds. But an inconvenient change in gauge or station can stop your diesel before it leaves the station.

When the base game came "back in print" in 2021, we added Company Charter cards. Those cards are also included in this expansion for our early adopters.

Name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield Chilling Reign
Description:
Seize the advantage with Pokémon of the frozen lands, including the powerful Ice Rider Calyrex VMAX and Shadow Rider Calyrex VMAX—plus the Galarian forms of Articuno, Zapdos, and Moltres—in Sword & Shield—Chilling Reign! Phantom hauntings, howling blizzards, and wild battles—expand the realms of your Pokémon strategy with new powers and new possibilities. Press on despite ghostly opposition, and claim total victory in the land of spectral snow with the Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Chilling Reign expansion!


     Over 190 cards
     Dozens of Pokémon originally discovered in the Galar region
     15 powerful Pokémon V and 8 enormous Pokémon VMAX
     New Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards
     More than 25 Trainer cards and 3 new Special Energy cards


—description from the publisher

Name: Timber Timmy
Description:
Each player gets a hammer (hammer head is hollow) with which he has to collect colored plastic hats in the correct order as quickly as possible. The order of the five colors is determined by a revealed card. The first player to collect 5 cards wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Robin Hood
Description:
Robin Hood is an old school style tactical solitaire board game of action and adventure, with a bit of wargame and RPG elements mixed in. An open-ended sandbox style game where the player may choose his own path.

Set in Nottingham Shire, England in the year 1180, the player will control up to 6 Merry Men at once. The Merry Men will frequently encounter enemy bandits, Nottingham soldiers, or possibly even Foresters in Sherwood Forest.

Game components include a Nottingham Shire map, various mats, a tables book, and several counter sheets representing individual Merry Men, soldiers, weapons, items, etc.

The player moves his band of Merry Men across map, searching for rich targets to steal from, visiting Newstead Abbey and The Blue Boar Inn to buy necessary items, gamble, or pick up new quests. They may even sneak into a castle in order to steal gold or rescue a peasant in the dungeon.

As the Merry Men earn more experience points, they will continue to improve their skills.

The ultimate goal of your Merry Men is to arm the towns of Nottingham Shire, convince them to rebel and attack Nottingham Castle, and remove the Sheriff from power before December 31st, 1180. To accomplish this, the Merry Men must increase Loyalty of the town to 10, plus arm the town with 10 weapons. The more towns that take part in the rebellion, the better chance they will have of succeeding in defeating Nottingham Castle and removing the Sheriff from power. But if the towns fail to remove the Sheriff before December 31st, the Merry Men will all be automatically hunted down and executed.

—description from the designer
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: Norrköping, Linköping (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description:
Fan expansion to Ticket to Ride, set out in the Swedish towns of Norrköping and Linköping. A two sided board has been professionally printed, along with ticket cards. A base game of Ticket to Ride is needed to play the maps!

The maps are much like the USA/Europe maps, but there are some special rules. In Norrköping there are tram tracks and a bonus for North-South/West-East and in Linköping players compete to build at the runway at the airport.

The maps work well with 2-5 players. Stations (TTR Europe) are not intended to be used, but 1-3 stations can be used at the players' own leisure, along with other expansions and add-ons.

Name: The Consultants
Description:
A fun strategy game in which players choose to play one out of 4 different consultants. Each consultant carries their own ability that players can build their strategy on. In the game, players manage their actions at the expense of working hours of which each player only has a limited amount for each round. Thus, resource management will be a key factor to win the game. Working hours can be used for lobbying politicians, getting an intern to receive additional working hours, receiving effect cards, or acquiring courses and projects which will educate your character and provide you with additional income.    While the game is round based, players can also take an active role, even if it is not their turn, by playing effect cards or participate in auctions for either projects or courses.

The base game can be played in three different versions. Which allow players to opt between an asymmetrical and symmetrical gameplay or change the numbers of components in the game to adjust the difficulty of play.

While the game mechanics require a strategic mindset, the actual theme of the game is a satire about the consulting industry. Effects like “Auditor” who is displayed as a blind person and approves important documents with his stamp, should remind players how shady the industry can be (Auditing firms caused the financial crisis in 2008 because they assigned ratings without evaluating them properly).

—description from the designer

Name: ダブルナイン (Double Nine)
Description:
A Love Letter type game where you are trying to build the highest double digit number by the end of the round.

Each player draws a card then plays it in one of two piles. The first pile is the tens, the second pile is the ones. At the end of the game, the player with the highest number wins. 99 is the max since the cards are numbered 0-9.

However, the number cards from 0 to 9 have various effects such as "one-time break", "card replacement", and "hand exchange" . By making good use of these card effects, players aim to get closer to the strongest number, Double Nine (99).

The second edition includes 20 expansion cards not available in the first edition.
—user summary

Name: Extra FAKTY
Description:
In Extra FAKTY, players take on the role of journalists working for an tabloid with dubious reputation.

There are two game modes during which players will outdo each other in building the most interesting headlines. Each title will consist of three elements, and it depends on the creativity and ingenuity of the participants whether the subject of the article turns out to be a sensational mishap, indecent behavior or a love intrigue.

In the competitive mode, players will compete in providing the best articles for their newspapers, while breaking the ranks of competitors.
In the cooperation mode, the players' task will be to jointly provide a pool of taken topics that will allow to close one issue of the newspaper

Name: Paint the Town Red: Vengeance Will Be Yours
Description:
A scenario, based on a classic Clint Eastwood Western.

The  mining  town  of  Lagos  a  remote  mountain  place in Inyo County. The local townsfolk fear the return of three notorious outlaws who they helped send to prison years ago, and when a mysterious gunfighter rides into town unannounced, the citizens of Lagos beg him for help. But the gunfighter, known only as “the  Stranger” is not here by coincidence. He has a mission of his own....

To play this scenario, you’ll need 13 cowboy miniatures and a small Western town. There are a dozen characters in this game, each with a custom character card. Assign each player in your game the role of an Outlaw or a Citizen. There is also a card for the Stranger, but he will appear randomly throughout the story and may be controlled by either side.

Before the game, each player will be asked to revisit a decision   from earlier in the film, providing an opportunity for you to write a new ending to the movie!

—description from publisher

Name: Game of the Year: The Board Game
Description:
Game of the Year is a thematic board game about making video games. It can be played solo, competitively or cooperatively.

In each session, players takes on the role of a video game publisher and release up to three titles. Players win if they are awarded Game of the Year. If they fail to be awarded Game of the Year (or run out of money prematurely) they lose.

A title is created in three phases. In the pitch phase, players combine a genre card with 1-2 themes and 2-3 features drafted from a shared pool. In the development phase, players choose from separate pools of dice employees to generate resources. These resources are used to complete the title's themes and features. In the release phase, the title is compared with a rival in order to determine its success.

Players must skilfully use resources to create stars and avoid bugs in order to succeed in the competitive video game marketplace. The rewards for doing so include money (used to play dice employees), tech tokens (used to remove bugs), reward cards (which grant players unique abilities), and additional hype (which must be maintained otherwise the company is forced to close).

—description from the publisher

Name: Finders Creeperz
Description:
"Finders Creeperz" is a uniquely clever and challenging game that requires a combination of strategy, luck and killer instinct.  A plethora of different gameplay scenarios will unfold giving a different outcome every time and fun for all of the family. The aim of the game is to trick and capture your opponents with the help of your CREEPER, action cards and traps (pre-game traps and on board traps) leaving you in the clear to get around the board and take the win. It's high paced from start to finish and you can be called in to action on anyone's turn. Just because your go is done, you are most certainly not safe. The attack/question cards are hectic and full of twists. Those who you think are your friends often turn out to be enemies and you are all but guaranteed to have to choose between one friend or another. We take no responsibility for any arguments that follow. Do you trap your kid or let your partner win? Will you put yourself in a trap just to send your best friend back to the start? OF COURSE YOU WILL! Be ruthless. Be bold.

Yes, we know that the vast majority of games claim to be equally as fun for parents as it is for kids but this one actually is... Trust me, as a parent there is little I enjoy more than the look on a kid's face go from joy and smugness when they think they are going to win, to despair and anger when they slowly realise they most certainly are not. It's like a fun punishment. "Funishment," if you will... After all, they'd most certainly do it to you! Life isn't fair and they will soon realise this.

Name: The Battle of the Denmark Strait: Fire at Sea – A WWII Naval Combat Game
Description:
The Battle of the Denmark Strait is played for as many turns as it takes one side to win.

Each turn is divided into the following four phases:

     Movement Phase: British first then German.  
     Shooting Phase: German shoots first then British. However shooting are considered to be simultaneous.
     Damage Control Phase: damage ships attempt to repair.
     Morale Phase: Ships that sustained hits on the current turn check morale.  Broken morale ships try to recover.


Once the Morale Phase is completed, return to the Movement Phase and begin a new turn.

Name: Le Trésor des Templiers
Description:
900 ans après la création de l'ordre en 1129, un carnet retrouvé en Ecosse, dans le Midlothian, rédigé par l'un des derniers chevaliers, met les joueurs sur la piste du trésor des Templiers.

900 years after the creation of the order in 1129, a notebook found in Scotland, in the Midlothian, written by one of the last knights, puts the players on the trail of the Templar treasure.

The players have to solve puzzles to find the treasure of the Knights Templar.

Name: Riding Shotgun: A Ruthless 5 Act Campaign
Description:
This mini-campaign is structured in five “acts,” or quick scenarios playable  in a single evening.

There is a map-based component to this game, representing a cat-and-mouse chase between the Cowboys and the Earp posse.

The Cowboy mission is to escape Cochise County for the relative  safety of either the New Mexico Territory or Sonora, Mexico. The  Earp  player will attempt to track the bandits and  bring them to justice before they can flee their jurisdiction!

Divide the players  into  two  teams:
One is given the Cowboy Briefing and the other receives the Earp Briefing. Each team should  read and record their decisions before reading or playing each new scenario. Players should refrain from studying individual scenario details beforehand (this preserves some surprises!)

At  the  end  of  each  act,  any  characters  that  were  killed are permanently removed from the campaign.

—description from the scenario

Name: From the Cellar: Pack 10
Description:
A themed scenario pack that examines two battles fought by the US Marines in WW2 and Korea.  The two battles are Tarawa, and Toktong Pass.

To play the Tarawa scenarios you will need the map from MMP's Blood Reef Tarawa module, as well as a map extension downloaded from the publisher's webpage.

Scenarios:
FT294: Cannonball & Company's Run
FT295: A Toe Hold on Red Beach 3
FT296: Go Get your Feet Wet, Boys
FT297: Black Beach Rendez-Vous
FT298: Finishing off the Tailenders
FT299: The Pocket
FT300: Fox in the Cold
FT301: Chinese Machinations
FT302: We Will Hold
FT303: Ridgeline Rondez-Vous

Name: Anyotas
Description:
Anyotas is a game based on the Congolese myth of the brotherhood of the leopard men. To which are grafted other mythical characters from the African pantheon such as Mami Wata, the Marabout, Anansi, Ibeji, the Witch Doctor, among others.

The game pits two teams: the Originels against Anyotas. 
The latter are hiding among the inhabitants of one of the African cities. At nightfall, they work together to attack a poor Originel. Then when the day comes, they pretend to be just an innocent Originel.

The goal of the game is simple:

     For the Anyotas eliminate all Originels during the night phases. When the Originels become outnumbered, the Anyotas win the game.
     For the Originels, unmask all Anyota before you are outnumbered. Thanks to their spirit of deduction but also with the help of Originels with powers such as the Marabout, the Hyena Trainer, Mami Wata etc ...


So can you survive the onslaught of the fierce Anyotas?

– Translated description from the publisher
Families: Country: Democratic Republic of the Congo
